chapter.title: Backing Up an &rmt; Server
chapter.para: This chapter explains how to create a backup of your &rmt; server and how to restore it.

sect1.title: Creating a Backup
sect1.para: This procedure details how to create a full backup of your &rmt; server. It is assumed that you have an external disk or network share mounted in /mnt/backup which serves as a target for the backup.

step.para: Create a file containing a dump of your SQL database. You need to provide the password you set for the rmt database user during the installation.
Optionally, create a copy of your mirrored data.

sect1.title: Restoring a Backup
sect1.para: This procedure details how to restore your &rmt; server from a backup created in . It is assumed that the backup is mounted in /mnt/backup. It is also assumed that you are restoring the server on a newly installed &slsa;.

step.para: Install and configure the &rmt; server as described in .
Use mysql to remove the newly created database and import the data.
Synchronize your data and update your repositories.
